passage.text: Impact of renal dysfunction on weaning from prolonged mechanical ventilation

The prognosis for patients who require PMV and RRT is very poor. The small number of patients with renal insufficiency not requiring RMT had a better hospital outcome and mortality, but their long-term survival was still poorer.
Despite progress in treating asthma and reactive bronchospasm since his introduction of heliox in 1935, mortality remains high due to inadequate treatment.

After a prolonged storage period of 28 days at 4Â°C and 24 hours at room temperature, all six ternary unsupplemented controlled mixtures were stable enough for normal therapeutic use. The choice of triglyceride mixture used was determined solely by the clinical and metabolic requirements of each regimen, as all other stability tests confirmed their stability.
